title: Weakly-supervised Audio Temporal Forgery Localization via Progressive Audio-language Co-learning Network
author: Junyan Wu (Sun Yat-sen University), Wenbo Xu (Sun Yat-sen University), Wei Lu (Sun Yat-sen University), Xiangyang Luo (Zhengzhou University), Rui Yang (Alibaba Group), Shize Guo (Zhengzhou University), ...
relevance_why: This work introduces methods for weakly-supervised audio forgery localization, which could enhance existing techniques in audio processing, particularly in the context of generative music or speech synthesis.
background: Audio temporal forgery localization identifies specific segments in audio that have been manipulated, utilizing weakly-supervised learning when detailed annotations are scarce.
contribution: This paper introduces the Progressive Audio-language Co-learning Network (LOCO) to solve the problem of localization under weak supervision, achieving state-of-the-art performance across multiple datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods for audio forgery localization require precise annotations, limiting their applicability in real-world scenarios where such data is hard to acquire.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work develops a co-learning framework that dynamically integrates audio features and language prompts to effectively address localization without full annotations.

key_innovation: The innovative use of audio-language co-learning and the progressive refinement strategy allows the method to adaptively learn relevant features from weak annotations.
real_world_impact: This method has the potential to significantly enhance the detection of audio manipulation, contributing to security in applications like authentication and content creation.
limitations: The paper does not address potential challenges in generalizing the approach to entirely new types of audio manipulations beyond those explored in the experiments.

new_terms.weakly-supervised learning: **Weakly-supervised learning** refers to training a model using incomplete or imprecise labels, rather than fully labeled data.
new_terms.Progressive Audio-language Co-learning N: LOCO is a method developed to jointly learn from audio signals and language prompts to better identify manipulated audio segments.

open_sourcing: Code and pre-trained models are available at https://github/ItzJuny/LOCO
